comment.body: @Duende: still going strong I see

Hey, I'm the 1+Gallery dev. @1pgallery is my alt account that I no longer use. As you can see in the post Saintian linked I implemented some new features. Could you give some information about your browser so I can look into why it's not working for you?
Git center is a bit annoying with that. It automatically redirects to 1GitEtc so I can't sign from the sidepanel. But I'll try signing from the commandline.
could you try again?
I'm not sure how they work through Git Center, but apart from that I do.
Looking good.

@Moor: The Usual Suspects is indeed a must.
**Primer** (2004) is a good indie sci-fi cult film. You need your almonds to be active while watching it though.
**Brazil** (1985) is an amazing dystopian sci-fi film by Terry Gilliam. Its striking visual choices have inspired among others Jean-Pierre Jeunet in his french movies *Delicatessen* (1991) and *La Cit√© des Enfants Perdus* (1995), worth watching with subtitles, they're some of the best French cinema has to offer.
I don't know in how far the following have a cult following, but movie critics really didn't like them when they came out: **The Shining** (1980), **The General** (1926), **Stalker** (1979, Russian), **They Live** (1988), **Demolition Man** (1993)
Some other ones I'd really recommend: **Akira** (1988, Animated), **Blade Runner** (1982), **Falling Down** (1993), **Twelve Monkeys** (1995)
they could, but only if they all use the same version

@draugrdeathlord@zeroid.bit: You forgot
- TL;DR (if you like thunderf00t, you'll like this guy, if ya don't you still might, videos are a bit more polished)
- Aydin Paladin (sociology, psychology and politics)
- Vernaculis (journalist gone rogue)
- Internet Historian (random internet stories)
- Frederik Knutsen/Down the Rabbit Hole (random in-depth internet stories)
- Count Dankula (random internet stories as told by an illegally funny scot, seriously, the Queen of England had him arrested)

I was really happy to see The Hated One on your list, he has some great IT/tech nightmare content.

If you like people talking about movies I recommend:
- Mooler/Mauler (guy who runs EFAP)
- E;R
- Red Letter Media
- Robothead
- YMS/YourMovieSucks

If you like history, warfare, castles, tanks etc.:
- Lindybeige (most awesome content)
- Shadiversity (can be a bit annoying, but he does really good analysis of history+fantasy)
- Scholagladiatore (mostly weapon stuff)
- Slingshot Channel/Joey Spargrave (german guy builds crossbows, catapults etc. for fun, not historically accurate)

@blurHY: If the problem with IPFS is mostly in it's dynamic addressing, that's something we could easily solve. I would say ZeroNet is not without it's own problems, certainly with scalability. The problem is that we haven't been able to test it a lot. I'd say the (0)8chan influx showed that it can't handle active sites with a lot of peers well in its current state, but from the code I've read I'm confident it's something we can improve upon. It will take some experimenting though.

I don't think IPFS or dat:// development should be stopped, it's just unfortunate there's not more developers working on ZeroNet. I've pointed out several times that IPFS really isn't a competitor to ZeroNet and could even be a technology we end up using within ZeroNet.

dat:// on the other hand really does seem to fit the same use-case, only not as good. One thing it does do well is keep a versioned site history.
That does seem like an important feature.

I tend to use WTFPL as license, it's got that "fuck you, copyright" feel to it, is really short and clear in it's phrasing and allows people to do pretty much anything with it except claiming it's theirs.
Before I just used to say that it's in the public domain, but apparently that's not accepted in some countries, you have to die first, lol.
The best way to prevent crack in your nasal passages is still not to do cocaine.
Because it's really just ZeroNet. No need to make auditory distinction. It's also far too early to put effort in branding or publicity.
@Mg0: On linux too? I'd heard that about Windows doing that but I'm pretty sure I've never seen my browsers in the task manager when they're not open on linux.
@ulrichard: Ouch,  that's unfortunate. I was hoping it would get better so I could buy one.

@ulrichard: Yes, anyone I've met with a Librem laptop was positive about them, but apparently mobile is a lot harder to get right than they expected. I still have a BQ 4.5 Ubuntu phone but the battery is only good for about a day now so I've switched back to a good ol' Nokia dumb phone until I find a smartphone that I feel is worth buying, and anything doubleplusunfree is off the table ;-)

If you do, make it a separate list. I use MOAB and I prefer to see what disinfo is being spread.

@Dilans: I really prefer I2P over Tor, particularly the I2Pd implementation. I think a network like ZeroNet would go perfectly hand-in-hand with it as I2P also bundles data packages together so it actually benefits from torrent-like transfers going through it.

@Styromaniac: The reason I use MOAB is to block disturbing content and spam, not disinfo and shilling (which can be highly subjective) I would really prefer if I had the option to use all of MOAB except the disinfo part.

@Styromaniac: Is it possible to have multiple user blocklists on MOAB? I don't want to pressure you into not having cexy on MOAB at all, I would just prefer to be given the choice to subscribe to MOAB for specific categories of mutables.
Nice, I think it's important people know what they're blocking and for what reason.
Haha, joke's on them, I haven't had a smartphone in years now.

Nice to hear! Crontab is a great tool to learn.

Would you be interested in adding new zeronet trackers to syncronite? I'm testing my new tracker now and will hopefully be able to release it soon.
I don't see any commits related to it, but if it is indeed fixed that would be great.
Maybe the people doing so are already on your blocklist? or there really aren't any.
@Aassddff ‚ú† Œ£ üáßüá∑ üëë: Be careful giving food to wild animals, they'll come back for more. Monkeys in particular.
Yes, this is a really nice feature :-) Can start hotspot with no internet, connect other computer/phone to it and synchronize zites.
What is ZeroMe Luna?

@Styromaniac: Neat, we should try to get Nofish to accept those changes!

Also you should probably add a description for each project in your bio.

the underlying technology is very interesting, I'd love to see ZeroNet use it as an optional communication backend, because the API with which ZeroNet allows sites to interact with data is a lot more useful
